txt.en:
'I can see that fortune smiled upon the Lumi-v채ki when you came to Forochel, friend, for you have done much to help us. I would ask for your aid again, but in a matter less dire than some others.

'Perhaps you have seen the Lumi-v채ki run across the ice? We do this with bones which we strap to our shoes -- we call them luistin. Our people have used these for centuries, travelling at great speed across the frozen land. At times though, one may stumble and fall and lose a luistin. Such a loss is a bitter one, as these luistin are difficult to make.

'If you encounter any luistin in your travels, bring them to me. I will try to reunite them with their owners.'
'You found one of our luistin! I will try my best to find out who the owner of it is, as I am sure they have missed it.\n\n'Thank you, friend [placeholder]!'
'You have not found any of our luistin yet? I am not surprised, for we do not lose them often. However, if you do find one, I will gladly take it and try to return it to its owner.'
Juha told you how the Lossoth are able to run across the ice at great speed with the bones they strap to their shoes.

Juha is at S청ri-kyl채 and Pynti-peldot in Forochel.\n\nJuha has asked you to keep a wary eye open for any of the luistin the Lossoth may have lost during their travels through the frozen wastes and bring them to him.
